text: All analyses of study data were performed using SAS software version 9.4 (SAS Institute Inc., Cary, NC, USA). Categorical variables were described as counts and percentages, whereas means and standard deviations (SD) were computed for continuous variables. The 95% confidence intervals for proportions were constructed using Clopper-Pearson exact tests. The independence of characteristics of study sample by caries status (presence or absence) was assessed using Pearson's chi-squared test (or Fisher's exact tests for smaller samples) and p values. Missing data were analyzed as a separate category (unknown or other) in corresponding variables.
